pageContext.claim: “Well, I don't think we have differences over Iran. I don't think that the president [of France] wants to see nuclear weapons, and neither do I. And that’s what it's all about. He doesn't want to see them having nuclear weapons, and I don't want to see them having nuclear weapons. And they won't have nuclear weapons.”
pageContext.analysis: Trump and French President Emmanuel Macron have a huge difference over Iran: the Joint Comprehensive Plan of Action (JCPOA), also known as the Iran nuclear deal. Trump withdrew the United States from the accord early in his presidency based on specious reasons. Macron continues to support the JCPOA and France remains a member.
